title: My experience as a Support main
body: I generally try to be a patient person and the moral support for my team, I aim to please, and sometimes this is probably what it looks like.

It kind of goes two ways.  ADC right now is a frustrating role to play - and I can understand why I am seeing so many tilting ADCs at the moment.  The role is no longer as clear as it used to be.  

By way of illustration, is the ADC the best and main:

* **Turret taker?**  No that's more for the top lane and the odd midlane split pushers now.  (Case in point: the rise of Ziggs "ADC")

* **Scaler with coin better than the others?**  Again no.  Quite a few assassins and top laners do that better.  A Yasuo or Tryndamere, for example, is off and running with 2 items - most of the ADCs need about one more item to get to that status (didn't use the word "level" here because the ADC is typically about 1-2 levels behind that same top laner at about the same time in the game).

* **Ranged damage dealer?**  Actually that's better done by most of the AP midlaners right now.  Hard to compete with them.

Literally, the ADCs have become "jack of all trades, master of none" because Riot just doesn't know what to do with AD damage and the botlane role.  It's really a mess.  Truth be told they should be the ones used to push the turrets quickly and be the one's to best scale with items purchased - not the Tryndameres, Yasuos, Camilles, etc. That used to be the main job - but the desire to de-tank top lane has had a nasty trickle-over effect.

Plus, in solo queue, it also does not help that most of the ganking types have started looking at botlane as a 2-for-1 meal deal.  If **either** one of the two botlane players on the other side is a bit weak, then it is like an open invitation for a free menu.

Is it any wonder that players don't want to play either support or ADC?  Please Riot start making the roles a bit clearer.

Oh I have been doing plenty of that, I am actually very good at it.

The issue is when you and your random ADC have no synergy.
For example I am a naturally safe player, I almost always plan some kind of escape or disengage from a fight, but about half my adcs... are agressive risk taking players. If I back off or don't go in at the right times I can severly tilt them... Or worse I hesitate, then join in thier madness getting us both killed instead of just letting them die (I have less issue letting people die when I am not support). 

There is also jungle synergy or warding help that I stuffed up early last season that landed me in silver. I am quite the obessive warder but I kept getting caught warding, now I really need adc or jungle help to get some of the warding I need done safely. If they just don't get it then we are left without the wards.

I agree with you. 

I am also a very safe player, I'll go in when the ADC "somewhat" engages or when jungle pings. But if they're willing to just go in as I'm about out of mana, I will stay back. I'll spam my buttons but the abilities will not perform and the ADC will probably cuss at me, which I won't care because it wasn't my fault. That's when the ADC is hella boosted asf and will probably keep dying because he's mad. 

As for the jungle, I also do wish that the jungler and ADC help with warding. Sometimes, only half of the map (bottom side of the map) is only warded and top + everywhere else is just dark as hell. Tbh, kind of hate it when people ping for you to put down a  ward but they have one too.... 

{{sticker:zombie-brand-mindblown}} **Why?**

I'm a more aggressive support, in fact I'm usually the one to call the shots before we all in them. There have been 3 moments so far (I've recently started to play a lot of support so I can't really say I main the position) where I ping my ADC an exact spot for them to position, they go there, and we all in them from that position.

Usually it's right in the open for a Blitz hook, but with a minion just a bit to the right so they can dodge it last second, or just a spot for the ADC to get "caught out" where we actually engage hard because it was actually a feint.

As another cautious, traditionally-magey Support main, I've recently found that Rakan goes really well with overaggressive ADCs. He's almost as good as Janna at getting them out, and sometimes he can even turn the whole thing on its head if he hits his CC properly. Of course, he's also not as good at surviving as Janna, so that part's a bit rougher.

I recently learnt to play Ez after years of just thinking he was a terrible champion where all I did was run away really well and never do any damage. But in grinding to mastery 5 with him I finally get it. He has strong burst damage, you really have to time your engage well then just fire off a flurry of spells and autos then either get the kill or hop back out of the fight and try agian later.

It is important to learn adcs as well as supports actually, then you can understand the champion you are suppose to be supporting.

It is the Vayne players that, almost, tilt me with thier very existance. Unlike Ez and Lucian players they do actually need the heals and peels. At some point in the game they are sure to tumble into the middle of the enemy team trying to outplay  2 v 5 and you are expected to keep them alive in that madness.  They all think they are Korean.
